content.description: Sit start with a small left hand edge and a large right hand edge. From there, crank up and make a big reach to a left hand bump, match next to it, let the feet cut, then work up the remaining edges, and finish it off.
content.protection: Several pads. The landing has several rocks that make for an uneven surface.
content.location: It climbs the east section of Riddler's south face.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the edge. From there, climb up and slight right on good edges to reach an easy finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads at least. The landing has several rocks that make for an uneven fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the east section of Riddler's south face.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand edge and a right hand sidepull block. From there, curl the legs, campus up to a good right hand, then bump the left up through a crimp to a jug, find your feet, then finish up the featured slab.
content.protection: A pair of pads will be fine. The landing is good, but there are rocks on either side of the landing.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Riddler.

content.description:
Sit start with hands matched on the diagonal edge. From there, make a big move out left to a jug mail slot, match on it, then work up and left using the edges and pockets, and finish up the slab.

Some the rock on this is friable. Be careful on what you pull on.
content.protection: At least a few pads. The landing has a tree and a some rocks behind where the problem climbs.
content.location: It climbs the northwest section of Riddler.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the arete. From there, move up to a good bump on the arete, match, then work right along the lip to the apex, throw a heel over, crank on the slab, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two will work well. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the the southeast arete of Riddler.

content.description:
Sit start with hands matched on the flake. From there, work up and left traversing the lip's seam to the apex, crank onto the slab, and top it out.

This one gets harder the further you climb. Keep the heel locked down the entire way, and it will go well.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. There is a rock that hogs a fair amount of the landing, but it doesn't affect the problem's flow or present much of a risk.
content.location: It traverses the east lip of Riddler.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the flake. From there, work up left on the flake, then come back right to a good edge, match, manage the neighboring bumps, and mantle on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good, but it's slightly uneven because of a rock.
content.location: It climbs the northeast arete of Riddler.
